pullRequest.body:
in finite-dimensional spaces over a complete field. This is used to showing that immersions are open.
NB: this result is false for general continuous maps (only surjectivity is open there).

From the sphere-eversion project.

----------

Placing the lemmas about normed groups is tricky (their natural place is Normed/Group/Basic, but they also require the topology on NNReal...). Better solutions welcome.

Aside: I don't see a good label for this; I would label with "baby differential topology" if I could.


---

Thank you for the useful comments. I have addressed them, so this is ready for another look.
awaiting-review

bors d+

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Indeed, thanks. Fixed now.
bors r+
Canceled.

No idea why the build was cancelled again ("merge conflict"? certainly not with my PR). In any case, let's try merging master.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7896439734/job/21550420342)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7896439734/job/21550420009)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7896439734/job/21550420234)

I'll note that you can get your result directly without going directly through `AntiLipschitz` (although ultimately it is using it under the hood somewhere), in the following way:
```lean
theorem isOpen_setOf_clm_injective [FiniteDimensional 𝕜 E] :
    IsOpen { f : E →L[𝕜] F | Function.Injective f } := by
  suffices this : ∀ (f : E →L[𝕜] F), Function.Injective f ↔ finrank 𝕜 E ≤ (f : E →ₗ[𝕜] F).rank by
    simpa [this] using isOpen_setOf_nat_le_rank (finrank 𝕜 E)
  simp_rw [LinearMap.rank, ← finrank_eq_rank]
  refine fun f ↦ ⟨by exact_mod_cast (LinearMap.finrank_range_of_inj · |>.symm |>.le), ?_⟩
  norm_cast
  rw [← add_zero (finrank 𝕜 (LinearMap.range (f : E →ₗ[𝕜] F))),
    ← f.finrank_range_add_finrank_ker]
  exact fun hf ↦ (LinearMapClass.ker_eq_bot (E →L[𝕜] F)).mp <| by
    simpa using Nat.eq_zero_of_le_zero (le_of_add_le_add_left hf)
```
That being said, I think we want the other results in this PR anyway, so no need to change your proof.

There is already a `[CompleteSpace 𝕜]` hypothesis in context.
```suggestion
theorem LinearMap.injective_iff_antilipschitz [FiniteDimensional 𝕜 E] (f : E →ₗ[𝕜] F) :
```

```suggestion
theorem ContinuousLinearMap.isOpen_injective [FiniteDimensional 𝕜 E] :
```

This phrasing to me sounds a bit better.
```suggestion
/-- The set of injective continuous linear maps `E → F` is open,
```
I agree! "An open condition" is common, but I don't see a need to this jargon.

This pulls in a *lot* of new dependencies, so we really shouldn't do this. `Analysis.Normed.Group.Basic` is too long already. Please start a new file `Analysis.Normed.Group.Lemmas` where you can put your new lemmas, and add a TODO to it saying we should split part of  `Analysis.Normed.Group.Basic` off into this file.

optional
```suggestion
    H.add_sub_lipschitzWith (φ - φ₀).lipschitz hφ⟩
```

```suggestion
## TODO

- Move lemmas from `Basic` to other places, including this file.
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: injectivity of continuous linear maps is an open condition

nodes.body:
I'll note that you can get your result directly without going directly through `AntiLipschitz` (although ultimately it is using it under the hood somewhere), in the following way:
```lean
theorem isOpen_setOf_clm_injective [FiniteDimensional 𝕜 E] :
    IsOpen { f : E →L[𝕜] F | Function.Injective f } := by
  suffices this : ∀ (f : E →L[𝕜] F), Function.Injective f ↔ finrank 𝕜 E ≤ (f : E →ₗ[𝕜] F).rank by
    simpa [this] using isOpen_setOf_nat_le_rank (finrank 𝕜 E)
  simp_rw [LinearMap.rank, ← finrank_eq_rank]
  refine fun f ↦ ⟨by exact_mod_cast (LinearMap.finrank_range_of_inj · |>.symm |>.le), ?_⟩
  norm_cast
  rw [← add_zero (finrank 𝕜 (LinearMap.range (f : E →ₗ[𝕜] F))),
    ← f.finrank_range_add_finrank_ker]
  exact fun hf ↦ (LinearMapClass.ker_eq_bot (E →L[𝕜] F)).mp <| by
    simpa using Nat.eq_zero_of_le_zero (le_of_add_le_add_left hf)
```
That being said, I think we want the other results in this PR anyway, so no need to change your proof.

Thank you for the useful comments. I have addressed them, so this is ready for another look.
